dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: OH MY GOD.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: O H M Y G O D.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: What now? Another crypto scam?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What now? Another crypto scam?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, listen to this. Shopify, right? The e-commerce giant?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, listen to this. Shopify, right? The e-commerce giant?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, whatever. They're big. So?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, whatever. They're big. So?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, they hit $84 BILLION last week. Briefly the most valuable company in Canada!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, they hit eighty four dollars B I L L I O N last week. Briefly the most valuable company in Canada!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its value peaked at $84 billion last week, briefly making it the most valuable company in Canada, and pushing the net worth of its 39-year-old CEO Tobias Lutke north of $6 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh huh. Good for them. What’s the point?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh huh. Good for them. What's the point?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: The point, A, is this one investor, Bessemer Venture Partners.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The point, A, is this one investor, Bessemer Venture Partners.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the usual story. They put in like, a million bucks and now they’re rich.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the usual story. They put in like, a million bucks and now they're rich.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, yes, but no! They put in $5.5 million in the first round, built up a 26% stake.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, yes, but no! They put in five point five dollars million in the first round, built up a twenty six percent stake.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The firm first invested $5.5 million in the companys initial funding round, and after additional investments built a 26% stake worth $500 million when it went public in 2015.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so they made a ton. Great for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so they made a ton. Great for them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But they, like, redistributed ALL their shares back to their partners by late 2018.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But they, like, redistributed A L L their shares back to their partners by late twenty eighteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Though as is the typical modus operandi of venture capital firms hold onto investments while the company scales and cash out following an IPO Bessemer had redistributed all its shares back to its partners by the end of 2018, when the company was worth $15 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Why on earth?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Why on earth?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Because, um, VC firms, they have to show returns, you know? Give back to their own investors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because, um, V C firms, they have to show returns, you know? Give back to their own investors.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Venture capital funds are typically under pressure to post returns on investments in private startups over a relatively short period of time, between five and 10 years, says Gornal. Once a company goes public, a venture firm will often sell its shares back to its own investors, which include pension funds and university endowments, giving them the option to hold their stake in the company or cash out.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but what was it worth then? Like, pocket change?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but what was it worth then? Like, pocket change?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No! It was worth $15 billion. And get this, they even had offers to buy their stake for $17 billion!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No! It was worth fifteen dollars billion. And get this, they even had offers to buy their stake for seventeen dollars billion!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By exiting Shopify two years ago, Bessemer left at least $17 billion on the table.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait. So they walked away from seventeen billion dollars?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait. So they walked away from seventeen billion dollars?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By exiting Shopify two years ago, Bessemer left at least $17 billion on the table.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Today? That stake would be worth, like, twenty-two billion dollars. Twenty-two!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Today? That stake would be worth, like, twenty-two billion dollars. Twenty-two!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Today Bessemers stake would currently be worth close to $22 billion, the firm says.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, wow. Okay, that’s... that’s actually kind of dumb.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, wow. Okay, that's... that's actually kind of dumb.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! The partner said he 'couldn’t comprehend that they would have this massive amount of success.'
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! The partner said he 'couldn't comprehend that they would have this massive amount of success.'
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I couldnt comprehend that they would have this massive amount of success at that time, says Alex Ferrara, the Bessemer partner who led Shopifys initial funding round in 2010.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, I mean, who could predict a pandemic boosting online retail, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, I mean, who could predict a pandemic boosting online retail, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even though a global pandemic does not factor into the forecast of most investors, Bessemers stake in Shopify stands out as a significant missed opportunity in venture investing because it is rare that a venture capital firm would have built such a large stake in a hot startup, says Will Gornal, a professor at the University of British Columbias Sauder Business School.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: True, but it's like, a once-in-a-lifetime miss. They made 80x their money, sure, but still.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but it's like, a once-in-a-lifetime miss. They made 80x their money, sure, but still.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While Bessemers one-time stake in Shopify might prove a once-in-a-lifetime type tech position, Ferrara says the firm will gladly take its realized returns on the deal: between 80x and 100x its initial investment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but... eighty times? I wouldn't be crying. Still, twenty-two billion. That’s a lot of zeros.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but... eighty times? I wouldn't be crying. Still, twenty-two billion. That's a lot of zeros.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It’s like, uh, they left $17 billion on the table.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It's like, uh, they left seventeen dollars billion on the table.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By exiting Shopify two years ago, Bessemer left at least $17 billion on the table.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oof. Kicking themselves, I bet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oof. Kicking themselves, I bet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Makes you rethink, like, exit strategies, you know?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Makes you rethink, like, exit strategies, you know?
